data.title: Wednesday Business Dinner
data.text: Wednesday night is half-price bottle of wine nights. Great wine prices! They do take reservations and it was pretty busy. Food was excellent, drinks were good, service was professional. A little slow, but again, the place full. Steamed clams appetizer was awesome! Fish and steaks were also excellent.

data.title: Excellent food! Great service!
data.text: Food excellent with a wonderful atmosphere. Very comfy. Really doesn't feel like you're in a farming community town. Very upscale.  Highly recommend!

data.title: Always excellent!
data.text:
This is our go-to spot for great dining in the Central Valley. We always have a great time and great service there. 

Special kudos to Jayton, who is always on top of his game. He mixes the best cocktails around. 

Tip:  always ask for the specials. They never disappoint, particularly when venison is on the menu!

data.title: Favorite place to eat in Turlock!
data.text: I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered here. Their chicken picatta is to die for! And Jennifer's PB dessert is the ONLY way to finish off your decadent meal at Bistro 234!!!

data.title: Great Place for a dinner with friends
data.text: My wife and I wanted to take our good friends to a special place for their Anniversary Dinner. It was a warm evening, so we decided to eat outside. The service was excellent, with the server making recommendations on appetizers, and main courses. Food was excellent and a special dessert was served to celebrate our friends anniversary. It was a fun evening and will return again soon.

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: Not only is this the nicest, friendliest place to have lunch or dinner it also has monthly wine/dinner pairings.  The staff is really great and food is fabulous.  Just try it once and you will come back again and again.  Nice location on the corner so if you are inclined on a weekend evening a great place to people watch.

data.title: Mixed review
data.text: our first time in Turlock as we were passing through. Upon a recommendation we ate dinner on a Thursday night at Bistro 234. The atmosphere and service was very much to our liking. Outdoor seating out of the breeze on a delightful fall evening. My husband had the Bistro steak that was cooked just as he ordered and came with plenty of garlic mashed potatoes and veggies. He really enjoyed his dinner. I was not very hungry and ordered the appetizer fish tacos. I received two large tacos but they weren't very tasty. The fish was highly breaded and I like fish tacos to be about the fish. I would never order them again but my husband wouldn't hesitate having the steak again.

data.title: GOOD, BUT SOMEWHAT DISAPPOINTING
data.text: This restaurant is one of the nicer restaurants in Turlock and we've eaten there many times when visiting the city. The service was great; our waitress was super friendly and helpful. The gnocchi was superb, rich with a generous portion size. The house salad was large enough for two and the dressing was quite good. The scallops were a disappointment. They were wrapped in bacon which totally overpowered any flavor of the scallops, resulting in a bland, forgettable dish. We'll undoubtedly go back, but a bit wiser.

data.title: great and original menu!
data.text: Wonderful food with fresh, local ingredients. Very comfortable atmosphere and tables. Waitstaff was very helpful with menu suggestions. Will definitely go back

data.title: Restaurant Review
data.text: Very good food but a little but not overly expensive.  Atmosphere is decent.  Staff, waiters and waitresses very accommodating.

data.title: Pretty Good
data.text: I loved their mac and cheese it's on the appetizer menu I also got the salmon for my dinner course and it was really good. I enjoyed my meal. It is little pricey but you get what you pay for. I would recommend.

data.title: Not a fan
data.text: I've tried this place three times now because I've heard people say they really like it.  Unfortunately, I haven't had that experience.  The menu is always the same, kinda boring, and just not as good as it needs to be.  I ordered the creamy tomato soup, which was just greasy.  I've tried salads, and a couple other dishes as well, but I always leave disappointed.  I also think the service needs improvement.  Downtown Turlock has really stepped up over the past couple of years, and Bistro 234 needs to step up their game if they want my business again. Too many better options.

data.title: Always consistenly good food!!
data.text:
We often go to Bistro 234 with the gang from work...usually for holiday dinners & sometimes for smaller business lunches.
The Spinach Salad is a go-to favorite!! With Pancetta,‎ herbed goat cheese, dried cranberries, capers, candied walnuts and grilled red onion in a sweet and savory dressing...it's almost a meal in itself. Buuuut...I usually have it in addition to the Chicken Marsala with mushrooms, sweet marsala wine, butter over penne pasta. To die for!!

data.title: Delicious food
data.text:
My friend and I shared the French onion soup and chicken marsala.  Both were absolutely delicious.  Another friend ordered the Diana torte for dessert, and I kid you not, it was as big as her head!!  Four of us shared it, and we still didn't finish the entire dessert!

They sat us in a corner table in the back by the wine room, which was nice and quiet, but it was also rather warm without much air circulation.  I noticed they had ceiling fans toward the front of the restaurant, but they did not have one where we were seated.

The service was excellent as well.  They kept our water glasses full and checked in frequently but not too frequently to make sure we had what we needed.

I would definitely return.

data.title: Date Night
data.text: This is one of the more "upscale" restaurants in downtown Turlock, minus the pretentious vibe. I'd say the culinary choices are more American then French. Food was excellent!! My date had a steak they cooked beautifully & portions were for real people, not rabbits. Pricing is about average for a date night too. My only reason for giving them 4 stars instead of 5 is the lack of a cocktail menu. They have a long list of wine & full bar, not sure why they don't market a house crafted cocktail menu!

data.title: Great location for an event!!!
data.text: We recently had a bridal shower in Bistro 234's wine room.  It was fantastic!  The staff was so accommodating, especially the manager Jayden.  He got on a ladder and was hanging decorations from the ceiling for us.  The food was delicious, extensive wine menu and amazing mixed drinks.  Another very nice feature was the opportunity for everyone to order off the menu, rather than a set menu for the group.  I would highly recommend  Bistro to everyone for an event.  I look forward to getting back there soon.  Thank you again Bistro crew and Jayden for lovely event!!!

data.title: Great for lunch!
data.text: We went to Bistro 234 for lunch with family. Great local products and a wide variety of food on the menu. Mahi mahi was delicious, but depending on which dish you take some could be a pit smaller portoin. I would recommend asking them how big the portion is before you order, so you know what to expect.

data.title: Great for date night
data.text:
We tried Bistro 234 on a Friday evening. No reservations. They had tables available outside, which was perfect for us. The wine list is impressive. We both had steaks for dinner and they were amazing. Full of flavor. We had the Key Lime Pie for dessert and it was fantastic! 

Nice atmosphere, attentive service. A gem in downtown Turlock!

data.title: Always Good Food
data.text: You cannot go wrong at the Bistro!  Great drinks, great appetizers, food, and especially dessert.  It is always busy, so make reservations or plan to make it worth the wait.

data.title: Don't do the steak.
data.text: Lunch is pretty good. Dinner choices are odd.  Do not do the steak unless you prefer a steak placed on top of mashed potatoes with the blood running through it. I could barely eat it.  Salads at lunch are good. Nice atmosphere.
